subject: [WIP] Global element defaults
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-22 02:24:46.000000000', 'files': ['bin/disk-image-create', 'lib/element-common'], 'message': '[WIP] Global element defaults

Currently there is no place to keep global variables to be exported to
all elements.  "lib/common-defaults" seems like it might be it, but
this is not sourced by instack -- it's really "common" to
disk-image-create & ramdisk-image-create

Create a separate file that can be sourced by
[disk|ramdisk]-image-create and instack to provide global variables to
elements.

To facilitate this, we add a "-d" command that outputs the location of
this file.  Wrappers (instack) should ensure this is sourced before
running any element scripts.

Change-Id: Ic37d04420236e45d0c7dc74c4bcfbe5a41d911cd
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Global element defaults

Currently there is no place to keep global variables to be exported to
all elements.  "lib/common-defaults" seems like it might be it, but
this is not sourced by instack -- it's really "common" to
disk-image-create & ramdisk-image-create

Create a separate file that can be sourced by
[disk|ramdisk]-image-create and instack to provide global variables to
elements.

To facilitate this, we add a "-d" command that outputs the location of
this file.  Wrappers (instack) should ensure this is sourced before
running any element scripts.

Change-Id: Ic37d04420236e45d0c7dc74c4bcfbe5a41d911cd

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-09-16 04:39:17.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/developer/caches.rst', 'elements/yum/pre-install.d/01-yum-keepcache', 'lib/common-defaults', 'elements/dpkg/root.d/99-shared_apt_cache', 'elements/dpkg/README.rst', 'elements/yum/root.d/50-yum-cache', 'elements/yum/README.rst', 'elements/yum/post-install.d/99-reset-yum-conf'], 'message': 'Add DIB_USE_PACKAGE_CACHE variable

Currently yum keeps a local package cache and symlinks it into the
build by default, and it can not be turned off.

On the other hand, deb builds have a similar mechanism with
DIB_APT_LOCAL_CACHE.

Consolidate these into a single DIB_USE_PACKAGE_CACHE flag that is by
default on (maintaining the status-quo) but able to be turned-off.
Add a deprecation note for DIB_APT_LOCAL_CACHE.  Document this in the
developer documentation on caches, and add references to the elements
documentation.

Change-Id: I084d950785f8c557ee795b69e38f13ab1a427322

commit_message:
Add DIB_USE_PACKAGE_CACHE variable

Currently yum keeps a local package cache and symlinks it into the
build by default, and it can not be turned off.

On the other hand, deb builds have a similar mechanism with
DIB_APT_LOCAL_CACHE.

Consolidate these into a single DIB_USE_PACKAGE_CACHE flag that is by
default on (maintaining the status-quo) but able to be turned-off.
Add a deprecation note for DIB_APT_LOCAL_CACHE.  Document this in the
developer documentation on caches, and add references to the elements
documentation.

Change-Id: I084d950785f8c557ee795b69e38f13ab1a427322

subject: Add DIB_KEEP_PACKAGE_CACHE variable
revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2015-09-16 04:39:17.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/developer/caches.rst', 'elements/yum/pre-install.d/01-yum-keepcache', 'lib/common-defaults', 'elements/dpkg/README.rst', 'elements/yum/root.d/50-yum-cache', 'elements/yum/README.rst', 'elements/dpkg/finalise.d/99-clean-up-cache', 'elements/yum/post-install.d/99-reset-yum-conf'], 'message': 'Add DIB_KEEP_PACKAGE_CACHE variable

Implement a flag DIB_KEEP_PACKAGE_CACHE which keeps downloaded
packages.

Note this is incompatible with the DIB_USE_PACKAGE_CACHE flag that
uses the external package-cache bind-mounted into the chroot.  We
*could* copy that cache back into the image at the end, but it might
contain all sorts of things from other runs that are not relevant to
the image currently building.  Documentation has been enhanced to
discuss this, and the script should fail with a useful message if you
try to enable both.

The DIB_DISABLE_APT_CLEANUP flag is deprecated for this generic flag.

The difference in build-size for fedora is about:

480M fedora.qcow2
708M fedora-with-cache.qcow2

362M ubuntu.qcow2
450M ubuntu-with-cache.qcow2

Change-Id: I55bac1c80bbfd4e94f0446dd15e6673a9573e90a
'}]
commit_message:
Add DIB_KEEP_PACKAGE_CACHE variable

Implement a flag DIB_KEEP_PACKAGE_CACHE which keeps downloaded
packages.

Note this is incompatible with the DIB_USE_PACKAGE_CACHE flag that
uses the external package-cache bind-mounted into the chroot.  We
*could* copy that cache back into the image at the end, but it might
contain all sorts of things from other runs that are not relevant to
the image currently building.  Documentation has been enhanced to
discuss this, and the script should fail with a useful message if you
try to enable both.

The DIB_DISABLE_APT_CLEANUP flag is deprecated for this generic flag.

The difference in build-size for fedora is about:

480M fedora.qcow2
708M fedora-with-cache.qcow2

362M ubuntu.qcow2
450M ubuntu-with-cache.qcow2

Change-Id: I55bac1c80bbfd4e94f0446dd15e6673a9573e90a

subject: [DNM] Separate initial state and create state
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-29 03:15:39.000000000', 'files': ['diskimage_builder/block_device/level3/mount.py', 'diskimage_builder/block_device/tests/config/multiple_partitions_graph.yaml', 'diskimage_builder/block_device/tests/config/multiple_partitions_tree.yaml', 'diskimage_builder/elements/zypper/finalise.d/10-mkinitrd', 'diskimage_builder/block_device/level2/mkfs.py', 'releasenotes/notes/incorrect-grub-label-5d2000215c0cc73e.yaml', 'diskimage_builder/lib/disk-image-create', 'diskimage_builder/block_device/tests/plugin/test_a.py', 'diskimage_builder/block_device/tests/test_mount_order.py', 'diskimage_builder/block_device/blockdevice.py', 'diskimage_builder/block_device/tests/plugin/test_b.py'], 'message': '[DNM] Separate initial state and create state

This is a bunch of work I did to separate out the initial state
from the state created during create()

We have a chicken and egg problem with the get-value calls; some of
them want values that are known after we've parsed all the
configuration (e.g. rootfs mount & file system type) ... logically we
could grab them from the state.  However, since state generation is
wrapped up with the actual create() calls, it's too late.

In theory, we could separate out initial state generation, from the
config file(s), and then do the create as a totally separate call

This has a few unresolved issues.  For example, we call "init" before
finding the size of the disk with "du", then we put the new size value
in and call "create"; which re-reads this.

So quite a lot of refactoring has to be done to get this idea to work.
I'm just putting this here as a record of how to get started if we
need this...

Change-Id: Ic86177015c5c22f32e2d0c598eed28ad891dc218
'}]
commit_message:
[DNM] Separate initial state and create state

This is a bunch of work I did to separate out the initial state
from the state created during create()

We have a chicken and egg problem with the get-value calls; some of
them want values that are known after we've parsed all the
configuration (e.g. rootfs mount & file system type) ... logically we
could grab them from the state.  However, since state generation is
wrapped up with the actual create() calls, it's too late.

In theory, we could separate out initial state generation, from the
config file(s), and then do the create as a totally separate call

This has a few unresolved issues.  For example, we call "init" before
finding the size of the disk with "du", then we put the new size value
in and call "create"; which re-reads this.

So quite a lot of refactoring has to be done to get this idea to work.
I'm just putting this here as a record of how to get started if we
need this...

Change-Id: Ic86177015c5c22f32e2d0c598eed28ad891dc218

subject: Add a parent log to iterate timeout util
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-06-15 07:18:22.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/cloud/openstackcloud.py', 'openstack/_log.py', 'openstack/utils.py', 'openstack/cloud/meta.py'], 'message': 'Add a parent log to iterate timeout util

With debug logs you get quite a lot of

 2018-06-15 02:06:38,671 DEBUG: openstack.iterate_timeout Waiting 2.0 seconds

as things progress.  Logically these messages are really related to
whatever called them, more than "openstack.iterate_timeout".  For
logging hierarchy purposes you'd prefer for it to be captured with its
parent, as it is indicating a loop happening there.

Add a parent argument to setup_logging that will indicate to register
the new logger as a child of this.

Use this argument in the util.iterate_timeout call

Plumb in some existing loggers as parents for most of the
iterate_timeout calls.

Change-Id: Ibc3afe21e8987b54f1de68bde5c9f1a30201304f
'}]
commit_message:
Add a parent log to iterate timeout util

With debug logs you get quite a lot of

 2018-06-15 02:06:38,671 DEBUG: openstack.iterate_timeout Waiting 2.0 seconds

as things progress.  Logically these messages are really related to
whatever called them, more than "openstack.iterate_timeout".  For
logging hierarchy purposes you'd prefer for it to be captured with its
parent, as it is indicating a loop happening there.

Add a parent argument to setup_logging that will indicate to register
the new logger as a child of this.

Use this argument in the util.iterate_timeout call

Plumb in some existing loggers as parents for most of the
iterate_timeout calls.

Change-Id: Ibc3afe21e8987b54f1de68bde5c9f1a30201304f

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-24 08:45:10.000000000', 'files': ['diskimage_builder/elements/devuser/environment.d/50-devuser'], 'message': "Bail on common devuser usernames

Using DIB_DEV_UESR_USERNAME=ubuntu caused a great deal of confusion,
because cloud-init can possibly come along and take over the username,
locking you out of password access and leaving us wondering why the
element didn't work.

Let's just enforce using a different username to avoid anyone else
wasting time with this.

Change-Id: Iae34f9dfbd34e592a3b64fb20e7104110739e623
Closes-Bug: #1766228
"}]
commit_message:
Bail on common devuser usernames

Using DIB_DEV_UESR_USERNAME=ubuntu caused a great deal of confusion,
because cloud-init can possibly come along and take over the username,
locking you out of password access and leaving us wondering why the
element didn't work.

Let's just enforce using a different username to avoid anyone else
wasting time with this.

Change-Id: Iae34f9dfbd34e592a3b64fb20e7104110739e623
Closes-Bug: #1766228

commit_message:
Increase backoffLimit to 10 for helm installer

The helm installer often quickly reaches the backoffLimit of 5. Increase
this to 10 so that there is a greater chance of successful installation.

Story: 2006765
Task: 37783

Change-Id: I5293c970bb1696f14c421fdf67abb495b4b8d666
Signed-off-by: Bharat Kunwar <brtknr@bath.edu>

subject: Revert "Fix #1627402: fix grub2 element for ubuntu xenial"
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6721, 'name': 'Ben Kero', 'email': 'ben.kero@gmail.com', 'username': 'ben-kero'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-11-30 07:11:22.000000000', 'files': ['diskimage_builder/elements/grub2/install.d/02-grub-install-spec', 'diskimage_builder/elements/grub2/pkg-map'], 'message': 'Revert "Fix #1627402: fix grub2 element for ubuntu xenial"

This reverts commit 003fc17208e645b453ccb7c7ad27d332bdae490c.

It seems this special handling is still needed.  The following command
fails with the error of:

 $ disk-image-create -o ubuntu.qcow2 ubuntu grub2
 ...
 "/usr/sbin/grub-probe: error: cannot find a device for / (is /dev mounted?)"

I also confirmed that reverting this change (adding the special
handling back) fixes the image building.

Change-Id: Ieb828a7861249044ce0ed1eb36d089d81992efd0
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Fix #1627402: fix grub2 element for ubuntu xenial"

This reverts commit 003fc17208e645b453ccb7c7ad27d332bdae490c.

It seems this special handling is still needed.  The following command
fails with the error of:

 $ disk-image-create -o ubuntu.qcow2 ubuntu grub2
 ...
 "/usr/sbin/grub-probe: error: cannot find a device for / (is /dev mounted?)"

I also confirmed that reverting this change (adding the special
handling back) fixes the image building.

Change-Id: Ieb828a7861249044ce0ed1eb36d089d81992efd0

commit_message:
Use pip list for saved output

With zuulv3 cloning, "pip freeze" doesn't show useful values for repo
installs as they don't have a remote.  Devstack switched to using "pip
list" in I33d25f86b6afcadb4b190a0f6c53311111c64521; do the same here
and also update the help page.

Change-Id: Id30cae9539b796dde51e4ea1834d4247e4b134da

subject: Add ability to download log bundles
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1, 'name': 'James E. Blair', 'email': 'jim@acmegating.com', 'username': 'corvus'}, {'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 4146, 'name': 'Clark Boylan', 'email': 'cboylan@sapwetik.org', 'username': 'cboylan'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}, {'_account_id': 6786, 'name': 'Sergey Lukjanov', 'email': 'me@slukjanov.name', 'username': 'slukjanov'}, {'_account_id': 7069, 'name': 'Joshua Hesketh', 'email': 'josh@nitrotech.org', 'username': 'jhesketh'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-23 01:58:48.000000000', 'files': ['os_loganalyze/downloader.py', 'os_loganalyze/tests/samples/26/118226/1/gate/gate-grenade-dsvm/fb63ac0/baz/bar/b.txt', 'os_loganalyze/tests/base.py', 'os_loganalyze/tests/samples/26/118226/1/gate/gate-grenade-dsvm/fb63ac0/foo/c.txt', 'os_loganalyze/tests/test_downloader.py', 'os_loganalyze/tests/test_filters.py', 'os_loganalyze/tests/samples/26/118226/1/gate/gate-grenade-dsvm/fb63ac0/a.txt', 'os_loganalyze/server.py', 'os_loganalyze/tests/test_wsgi.py'], 'message': "Add ability to download log bundles

This change provides a small additional wsgi application to download a
tarball of logs for a single test run and related test-cases.

The idea is for a modified URL such as

  http://logs.openstack.org/download/26/118226/1/gate/gate-grenade-dsvm/fb63ac0/

to initiate a download of a file called
118226_1_gate-grenade-dsvm_fb63ac0.tar.gz which includes a copy of all
logs for the test.

There are many way to skin this cat.  To explain some of the choices

 - The logs are compressed to a temporary file which is streamed back
   via wsgi.  This allows us to set the content-length correctly so
   you get what looks like a normal download, and wsgi streams the
   large file efficiently.

 - log packages are around 7MiB from my testing.  This is big but not
   ridiculous.

 - The risk I can see here is if a unfriendly spider decided to
   request every download it possibly could.  In this case, the script
   would start returning 500 errors when it could not create the
   archive.  Due to the existing way we uncompress files for sending,
   a recursive wget (ignoring robots.txt) would be much harder on the
   server than this would be and that doesn't seem to be a problem at
   the moment (people probably do this now to get access to all the
   logs quickly).  We could partition it to use a separate temp space
   if there is a problem.

 - Probably the best alternative is ZipStream [1].  Several issues:
   the pypi version seems to come from a forked source [2], it's a
   .zip, which isn't super-unixy, we don't know the content-length so
   we get no progress.  Given this and the size of the log packages, I
   don't think it this is a better approach for now.

 - The log link can be provided in the readme stuff that gets
   displayed with the logs when this is active

[1] https://github.com/SpiderOak/ZipStream
[2] https://pypi.python.org/pypi/zipstream

Change-Id: I6741d2514ae9cfef604243b9ce7063817be1ba3a
"}]
commit_message:
Add ability to download log bundles

This change provides a small additional wsgi application to download a
tarball of logs for a single test run and related test-cases.

The idea is for a modified URL such as

  http://logs.openstack.org/download/26/118226/1/gate/gate-grenade-dsvm/fb63ac0/

to initiate a download of a file called
118226_1_gate-grenade-dsvm_fb63ac0.tar.gz which includes a copy of all
logs for the test.

There are many way to skin this cat.  To explain some of the choices

 - The logs are compressed to a temporary file which is streamed back
   via wsgi.  This allows us to set the content-length correctly so
   you get what looks like a normal download, and wsgi streams the
   large file efficiently.

 - log packages are around 7MiB from my testing.  This is big but not
   ridiculous.

 - The risk I can see here is if a unfriendly spider decided to
   request every download it possibly could.  In this case, the script
   would start returning 500 errors when it could not create the
   archive.  Due to the existing way we uncompress files for sending,
   a recursive wget (ignoring robots.txt) would be much harder on the
   server than this would be and that doesn't seem to be a problem at
   the moment (people probably do this now to get access to all the
   logs quickly).  We could partition it to use a separate temp space
   if there is a problem.

 - Probably the best alternative is ZipStream [1].  Several issues:
   the pypi version seems to come from a forked source [2], it's a
   .zip, which isn't super-unixy, we don't know the content-length so
   we get no progress.  Given this and the size of the log packages, I
   don't think it this is a better approach for now.

 - The log link can be provided in the readme stuff that gets
   displayed with the logs when this is active

[1] https://github.com/SpiderOak/ZipStream
[2] https://pypi.python.org/pypi/zipstream

Change-Id: I6741d2514ae9cfef604243b9ce7063817be1ba3a

commit_message:
Add devstack no-download sentinel

Add sentinel file to devstack cache directory to prevent devstack runs
trying to download images during test runs.  Test images will need to
be added to the cache before they can be used (see
I7db026ad20f30b457522fbffd8e0a90787d69a99)

Change-Id: I23cdeb6757e2a633b634b6db7353acb8122e4745
Depends-On: Iace57fd0042c35535e72a3b316ea594516968113

commit_message:
Add chrony time sync, small refactor

Switch the time sync to preferring chrony if the client is installed.
While we are here, refactor this slightly into the setup function
(rather than the timer start function) as it seems more like a
"setupy" thing to be doing.

See also I5e524588417c37691b9c1f6a2d3dccdb1f2340c8 for chrony install
on system-config

Change-Id: I4d827bd6761ac7e9359a0ec2a9f803c52becc859

subject: Run external_post_deploy_tasks at every step
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 20172, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@acksyn.org', 'username': 'michele'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2019-12-10 19:53:18.000000000', 'files': ['common/deploy-steps.j2', 'deployment/nova/nova-az-config.yaml', 'deployment/nova/nova-compute-common-container-puppet.yaml'], 'message': 'Run external_post_deploy_tasks at every step

This patch allows the external_post_deploy_tasks to run at every step.
Before, the ansible tasks were only executed at the very end of the
deployment, but this interface can be useful to be also run after the
containers are deployed for each step.

This can be done by running external_post_deploy_tasks at every step.

Note 1: for the existing tasks, force the step to be 5 as it used to be
run after the step 5 (nova-az and nova-compute). The result will be the
same.

Note 2: "Server Post Deployments" task will be executed *after* the
external_post_deploy_tasks of step 5 (instead of before); but it
shouldn't change anything for the deployment.

Note 3: It's using a new way of running tasks where it only include the
tasks if they exist for that role AND for the step; so we don't waste
time including skipped tasks.

After this patch, this interface will be used to create the keystone
resources (endpoints, users, etc) with Ansible at the end of the step 3,
once the Keystone container is up.

Depends-On: I7dc5e9c67952c08d68fcd59f7fd103d35b5dc279
Change-Id: I5319097f16358673c6cee0d8a39e6d98cf7a873b
'}]
commit_message:
Run external_post_deploy_tasks at every step

This patch allows the external_post_deploy_tasks to run at every step.
Before, the ansible tasks were only executed at the very end of the
deployment, but this interface can be useful to be also run after the
containers are deployed for each step.

This can be done by running external_post_deploy_tasks at every step.

Note 1: for the existing tasks, force the step to be 5 as it used to be
run after the step 5 (nova-az and nova-compute). The result will be the
same.

Note 2: "Server Post Deployments" task will be executed *after* the
external_post_deploy_tasks of step 5 (instead of before); but it
shouldn't change anything for the deployment.

Note 3: It's using a new way of running tasks where it only include the
tasks if they exist for that role AND for the step; so we don't waste
time including skipped tasks.

After this patch, this interface will be used to create the keystone
resources (endpoints, users, etc) with Ansible at the end of the step 3,
once the Keystone container is up.

Depends-On: I7dc5e9c67952c08d68fcd59f7fd103d35b5dc279
Change-Id: I5319097f16358673c6cee0d8a39e6d98cf7a873b

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-12-11 04:40:07.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/workflows/views.py'], 'message': 'GUI hangs on creation of project in User creation form

On creation of project in user creation form, the response is sent
as html and the javascript try to parse the output as json and fails.

The project creation response should be sent as text/plain so that
javascript can parse the string as json.

The bug have 3 parts
1. Users are not listed on GUI in different domain
2. Projects are not listed on GUI in different domain
3. Gui hangs during creation of user/project using + option
Case 1 & 2 are fixed at https://review.opendev.org/#/c/697962/
This patch fixes case 3.

Change-Id: I4936a158ad99cf9d7514e79c06ed2315ce11218b
Closes-Bug: #1826114
'}]
commit_message:
GUI hangs on creation of project in User creation form

On creation of project in user creation form, the response is sent
as html and the javascript try to parse the output as json and fails.

The project creation response should be sent as text/plain so that
javascript can parse the string as json.

The bug have 3 parts
1. Users are not listed on GUI in different domain
2. Projects are not listed on GUI in different domain
3. Gui hangs during creation of user/project using + option
Case 1 & 2 are fixed at https://review.opendev.org/#/c/697962/
This patch fixes case 3.

Change-Id: I4936a158ad99cf9d7514e79c06ed2315ce11218b
Closes-Bug: #1826114

commit_message:
Update override for keystone resources

The existing override was double quoting the override options which would
lead the config generator to double quote keys in the rendered data. This
change modifies the override data to make it use a jinja data structure
which will ensure we're not having to deal with quoting issues.

commit_message:
Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

python-ironicclient is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/691178/

Change-Id: Iacc50fde00f0d24e9c6ee2b1ac61b8fa060094fb

commit_message:
Pass on missing implementation while filtering

The in_() filter isn't implemented yet for relations. Since these are
being used in multiple locations in order to add new attributes to
objects, we ignore the resulting error and allow the filtering to be
applied by the corresponding result_filter hook afterwards.

Change-Id: Ie91656387f7a7e60738a63bc28bf9bd505407cff
Partial-Bug: 1818318

commit_message:
Set containerized_undercloud to false

Feature set 047 is the non-containerized upgrade featureset. We need to
explicitly configure containerized_undercloud to false because in Rocky,
it's set to true by default.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/698963/

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-12-13 11:19:27.000000000', 'files': ['vars/main.yml'], 'message': "l3 agent on network_hosts do dvr_snat, anywhere else dvr

Checking for physical_host_group could make this patch work for

backport it that far.

Change-Id: I6bb24a8719b3902d6f510c70705cdb63076a1a08
Signed-off-by: Erik Berg <openstack@slipsprogrammor.no>

commit_message:
l3 agent on network_hosts do dvr_snat, anywhere else dvr

With the change in queens of moving the neutron agents from
containers onto the network_hosts, if those hosts happen to
also be your nova_computes, VM's without a floating ip would
lose north/south network.

Checking for physical_host_group could make this patch work for
neutron_agents_containers on pike aswell, if we want to
backport it that far.

Change-Id: I6bb24a8719b3902d6f510c70705cdb63076a1a08
Signed-off-by: Erik Berg <openstack@slipsprogrammor.no>
(cherry picked from commit edf0a25ca2e78658f06a2394a4ded60b49232bca)

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2019-11-15 22:09:12.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/test_agent_base_vendor.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/api/controllers/v1/test_ramdisk.py', 'ironic/conductor/manager.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/conductor/test_utils.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/conductor/test_manager.py', 'ironic/api/controllers/v1/ramdisk.py', 'ironic/conductor/utils.py', 'releasenotes/notes/prevent-callback-url-from-being-updated-41d50b20fb236e82.yaml'], 'message': 'Block ability update callback_url

A malicious user with:

* API access normally reserved for the provisioning,
  cleaning, rescue networks.
* Insight about a node, such as a MAC address, or baremetal node
  UUID.
* Insight into the state of the node, such as the access provided
  to Compute API users, or other Bare Metal API users.

Can submit an erroneous ``heartbeat`` to the ironic-api endpoint
with a ``callback_url`` that is not of the actual intended agent.
This can potentially cause a rescue, cleaning, or deployment
operation to be derailed, or at worst commands to be sent to
to an endpoint the malicious user controls.

Story: 2006773
Task: 37295
Change-Id: I1a5e3c2b34d45c06fb74e82d0f30735ce9041914
'}]
commit_message:
Block ability update callback_url

A malicious user with:

* API access normally reserved for the provisioning,
  cleaning, rescue networks.
* Insight about a node, such as a MAC address, or baremetal node
  UUID.
* Insight into the state of the node, such as the access provided
  to Compute API users, or other Bare Metal API users.

Can submit an erroneous ``heartbeat`` to the ironic-api endpoint
with a ``callback_url`` that is not of the actual intended agent.
This can potentially cause a rescue, cleaning, or deployment
operation to be derailed, or at worst commands to be sent to
to an endpoint the malicious user controls.

Story: 2006773
Task: 37295
Change-Id: I1a5e3c2b34d45c06fb74e82d0f30735ce9041914

commit_message:
Nova: add net-tools package

This PS adds the net-tools package to the nova image, required for
the 'route' command.

Addtionailly voting is turned off for opensuse openstack image builds,
untill we can break out the package name definition between distros.

Change-Id: I74ed18620de33a2af2aac6b8719bbbcc925685da
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

commit_message:
Enable healthcheck script in clustercheck service

The clustercheck container uses the same container image as the mysql
service. That image already contains a healthcheck script that can
monitor either mysql or clustercheck. So we can enable healthcheck
in the clustercheck service as well.

Change-Id: I36602a20822b5544e8c1cd2aa0d8ae4a84de1c6e
Closes-Bug: #1856085

commit_message:
Fix use of urlparse.urljoin

This method only joins the first two parameters, the 3rd parameter
is a bool "allow_fragments". Passing in "object_name" as the third
param resulted in it getting lost. Use os.path.join instead.

Change-Id: I49506b2671465bf43ae346225919d4a0e6767b20

subject: Update: Ensure parallel execution
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2019-12-10 16:09:11.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/common/adjust-roles-data.yaml'], 'message': 'Update: Ensure parallel execution

In middle of Queens and Rocky release we introduced option to
set parallel execution of minor update on selected role types.
If the environment went through FFWD or was deployed before this
option got backported we need to update the roles_data.

By default we have update_serial either unset at all for OSP13 and OSP14 or
we have it set where Pacemaker enabled nodes, CephOSD nodes and Networkers
have it set to 1. This is mostly defensive precaution and we do allow running
in parallel for CephOSD and Networkers for production systems that did enough
testing on preprod or can take small outage. We should also parallelize it in
CI as we just waste time here.

Change-Id: I4cff09dc6aa9ac944b20a52ae087a8923f55209f
(cherry picked from commit 2044957694d89eee9529d889859f0788767f7e28)
(cherry picked from commit ad0e9b3954a95eb19764ba7720a2649737119d49)
'}]
commit_message:
Update: Ensure parallel execution

In middle of Queens and Rocky release we introduced option to
set parallel execution of minor update on selected role types.
If the environment went through FFWD or was deployed before this
option got backported we need to update the roles_data.

By default we have update_serial either unset at all for OSP13 and OSP14 or
we have it set where Pacemaker enabled nodes, CephOSD nodes and Networkers
have it set to 1. This is mostly defensive precaution and we do allow running
in parallel for CephOSD and Networkers for production systems that did enough
testing on preprod or can take small outage. We should also parallelize it in
CI as we just waste time here.

Change-Id: I4cff09dc6aa9ac944b20a52ae087a8923f55209f
(cherry picked from commit 2044957694d89eee9529d889859f0788767f7e28)
(cherry picked from commit ad0e9b3954a95eb19764ba7720a2649737119d49)

It's recommand to use this way. With tox is not really necessary to do

https://snarky.ca/why-you-should-use-python-m-pip/

commit_message:
Use python -m pip instead pip command.

It's recommand to use this way. With tox is not really necessary to do
it but it can be good to use it. See this article:

https://snarky.ca/why-you-should-use-python-m-pip/

For example python -m pip executes pip using the Python interpreter
you specified as python.

Change-Id: I99ba462eb3558bb45b8143cc2d20e72f8455033f

subject: Update: Run all roles update at once
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-12-05 16:50:44.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/update/overcloud_update_run.yml'], 'message': 'Update: Run all roles update at once

Previously we ran role by role which is not necessary and not
intended way of production update. In case of proper testing on
preprod customers should run update as fast as possible which
means leveraging ability to run all roles at once and even all
nodes of selected roles at once. With this patch the Pacemaker
enabled roles will still update in serial but the roles will be
done in parallel. In case of 3 controller 3 database 3 messaging
setup it will look roughly like this:

Update of controller[0] database[0] messaging[0]
Update of controller[0] database[1] messaging[1]
Update of controller[1] database[2] messaging[2]
Update of controller[2]

This is due to not blocking between roles and each role taking
different amount of time to apply the update. At any moment the
pacemaker quorum is not broken.

Change-Id: Ib119210139886382726bc0ccddfdb4f7f6803015
(cherry picked from commit a2b433133de755c410d235172c0644173d17ae80)
'}]
commit_message:
Update: Run all roles update at once

Previously we ran role by role which is not necessary and not
intended way of production update. In case of proper testing on
preprod customers should run update as fast as possible which
means leveraging ability to run all roles at once and even all
nodes of selected roles at once. With this patch the Pacemaker
enabled roles will still update in serial but the roles will be
done in parallel. In case of 3 controller 3 database 3 messaging
setup it will look roughly like this:

Update of controller[0] database[0] messaging[0]
Update of controller[0] database[1] messaging[1]
Update of controller[1] database[2] messaging[2]
Update of controller[2]

This is due to not blocking between roles and each role taking
different amount of time to apply the update. At any moment the
pacemaker quorum is not broken.

Change-Id: Ib119210139886382726bc0ccddfdb4f7f6803015
(cherry picked from commit a2b433133de755c410d235172c0644173d17ae80)

commit_message:
Update neutron ovs agent for ovs-dpdk

This ps update neutron ovs agent to support properly:
- setting mtu on dpdk bond and nic interface port
- setting vhost-iommu-support on dpdk bond and nic interface port
- setting n_txq values on dpdk bond and nic interface port

Change-Id: I422fa21a622642ecb7c49914fef04073e4f984bc

commit_message:
External Ceph: template cinder backend config when cinder_backend_ceph

Currently External Ceph Cinder config requires the user to create cinder
service custom configuration.

This change alters the if/else statements to template out cinder backends
configuration when cinder_backend_ceph is True.

Change-Id: I143c3b44d2839e56d1dbf28484c0eaae0a753dc9

commit_message:
Remove broken target sync extension

When we removed the pool-manager this was missed and the

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-12-16 15:55:58.000000000', 'files': ['deliverables/ussuri/horizon.yaml'], 'message': 'Release horizon 17.1.0 (ussuri)

We bumped the default Django version to 2.2 in upper-constraints.txt
but the latest release of horizon caps the Django version to <2.2.
This leads to the situation that horizon plugins cannot install
horizon from PyPI. This is the main motivation of this release.

Change-Id: Id4f1ac6a714d709997b12a46883d575e70dff107
'}]
commit_message:
Release horizon 17.1.0 (ussuri)

We bumped the default Django version to 2.2 in upper-constraints.txt
but the latest release of horizon caps the Django version to <2.2.
This leads to the situation that horizon plugins cannot install
horizon from PyPI. This is the main motivation of this release.

Change-Id: Id4f1ac6a714d709997b12a46883d575e70dff107

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2019-12-13 19:46:14.000000000', 'files': ['nova/notifications/objects/image.py', 'nova/tests/unit/notifications/objects/test_notification.py', 'nova/objects/image_meta.py'], 'message': "DRY: Build ImageMetaPropsPayload from ImageMetaProps

ImageMetaPropsPayload (for notifications) was supposed to contain
exactly the same fields as ImageMetaProps itself; and the SCHEMA member
was those same keys in a trivially different shape. And we were having
trouble remembering to keep these two objects in sync before. So this
commit eliminates the repetition and just generates
ImageMetaPropsPayload's `fields` and `SCHEMA` from
ImageMetaProps.fields.

Change-Id: I7dc38f7f5a62098fb0c366736f27e23bd7b7ee86
"}]
commit_message:
DRY: Build ImageMetaPropsPayload from ImageMetaProps

ImageMetaPropsPayload (for notifications) was supposed to contain
exactly the same fields as ImageMetaProps itself; and the SCHEMA member
was those same keys in a trivially different shape. And we were having
trouble remembering to keep these two objects in sync before. So this
commit eliminates the repetition and just generates
ImageMetaPropsPayload's `fields` and `SCHEMA` from
ImageMetaProps.fields.

Change-Id: I7dc38f7f5a62098fb0c366736f27e23bd7b7ee86

commit_message:
Update Neutron's Grafana dashboard

Recently we removed some old jobs from our check and gate queues.
We also added some new jobs related to ovn backend and some periodic
jobs.  This patch updates Neutron Grafana dashboard to be up to date
with our jobs.

commit_message:
Mark Brocade FC ZM driver unsupported

Brocade has indicated they will no longer be supporting their zone
manager driver and have requested help is getting it marked deprecated
and removed.

This marks the driver as deprecated for the Ussuri release. It us
subject to removal in the V release.

Change-Id: Ic92bd9f04f9976265e6699ddb7afa350a4081c09
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

subject: CI: Set zuul's ansible_python_interpreter to python2
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1, 'name': 'James E. Blair', 'email': 'jim@acmegating.com', 'username': 'corvus'}, {'_account_id': 14826, 'name': 'Mark Goddard', 'email': 'markgoddard86@gmail.com', 'username': 'mgoddard'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22629, 'name': 'Michal Nasiadka', 'email': 'mnasiadka@gmail.com', 'username': 'mnasiadka'}, {'_account_id': 24072, 'name': 'Marcin Juszkiewicz', 'email': 'mjuszkiewicz@redhat.com', 'username': 'hrw'}, {'_account_id': 30491, 'name': 'Radosław Piliszek', 'display_name': 'Radek', 'email': 'radek@piliszek.it', 'username': 'yoctozepto', 'status': 'self-employed techologist, collaborating mostly with 7bulls.com'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2019-12-13 09:20:39.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/base.yaml'], 'message': "CI: Set zuul's ansible_python_interpreter to python2

Train, Stein & Rocky only

Zuul seems to have started setting ansible_python_interpreter to python3
on Ubuntu, which breaks our installation of kolla-ansible on Train and
earlier stable branches.

This change sets ansible_python_interpreter explicitly to python2. We
use host-vars rather than vars because zuul sets a host-var for
ansible_python_interpreter=auto, which overrides vars.

Change-Id: I9ba0d16972b31a64617461461fafaf2b436e2bdf
"}]
commit_message:
CI: Set zuul's ansible_python_interpreter to python2

Train, Stein & Rocky only

Zuul seems to have started setting ansible_python_interpreter to python3
on Ubuntu, which breaks our installation of kolla-ansible on Train and
earlier stable branches.

This change sets ansible_python_interpreter explicitly to python2. We
use host-vars rather than vars because zuul sets a host-var for
ansible_python_interpreter=auto, which overrides vars.

Change-Id: I9ba0d16972b31a64617461461fafaf2b436e2bdf

commit_message:
Update Ceph images to Nautilus 14.2.5 packages

The Ceph package repo has been updated to include Nautilus 14.2.5
packages. This change adds comments to the Dockerfiles for all of
the Ceph images to specify the Ceph version and prompt a rebuild
of the images that will include the updated packages.

Change-Id: Ief2f29172cfa77898c438ff6bfd585b83fa55325

commit_message:
Delegate and run once debug start-at-task messages

Instead of executing these debug tasks for every host, we can delegate
them to localhost and only run them once.

Change-Id: I367db4c9e743c77f121751ecca6bb4996b8a3df9

commit_message:
[ceph-client][ceph-osd] Adjust required_percent_of_osds parameter

and incorporate in ceph-osd testing.

This parameter is used by helm test to check if a set % of OSDs
out of the total are considered in & up. Adjusting to 75% and
adding to helm-test.sh for ceph-osd along with more robust
ceph osd validation function

Change-Id: Ib1f37b901f8656f0c6f2ed6a3ec27f0357e82278

shouldn't start enforcing this here.

W504 takes the opposite stance of W503.

"}]
commit_message:
Ignore pep8 W503/W504

W503 has been reversed in current pep8, so we
shouldn't start enforcing this here.

W504 takes the opposite stance of W503.

Neither of these seem worth enforcing in our
code for now, just punt on a strict rule for
this and aim for readable code.

Change-Id: Id38b2629ea22792bbc7b4dce77fa9e7039be140f
(cherry picked from commit 80e37a3e6117d9b458d47de248cfad1431a62d4a)
(cherry picked from commit 61346f10029fd38613e5ae7593660405ecbac71f)

commit_message:

Change to be like the Neutron dashboard with both failure rate
and number of jobs run per section.  This will allow us to
better understand how the Octavia jobs are running over time.

commit_message:
fix get the name servers for a zone not validate zone_id

now the api of get /v2/zones/{zone_id}/nameservers not validate zone_id,
if set zone_id contain spaces, will trigger DBError and return 500.

Change-Id: Ia3e07c42dc548207aa7ff9efcc35a215c9660e54
(cherry picked from commit 0ba52bfb62cb64992a06b64c44f3e6a9dcadc193)

commit_message:
Support configuration of Docker client timeout

Adds support for configuration of the Docker client timeout via
'docker_client_timeout'.

This change also increases the default timeout to 120 seconds, as we
sometimes see timeouts in CI and heavily loaded or underpowered
environments. Increasing 'docker_client_timeout' further may be helpful
in cases where Docker reports 'Read timed out'.

Change-Id: I73745771078cb2c0ebae2b1d87ba2c4c12958d82
Closes-Bug: #1809844
(cherry picked from commit 01050dc01fa8558eb453c48faa2a8efd398c5367)

commit_message:
Refactor _gen_resource_inventory

This refactors _gen_resource_inventory as suggested in [1], simplifying
by removing unused fields which duplicated defaults that are set by
placement itself.

This patch introduces the previously absent test suite for conductor
manager.

[1] I0aac84a1fc6b00b5523927bee27f7491daecd786

Change-Id: I79379f55f3ea0690c58a7835d1e8c31117245626

commit_message:
improve JSON examples for PCI Passthrough config

Breaks up an example section of the README.md dealing with
pci-passthrough-whitelist in such a way that syntax-highlighting of
example yaml blocks are easily copiable.  Also, resolves an issue
with the example for multiple whitelisted devices by removing a
trailing tick (`).

Change-Id: I3ecd01957efa10e240bebb16dde33b0bd6347ef9

commit_message:
Fix openstack release in gates

Change I7def8df68371deda0b75a685363c8a73b818dd45 removed one
line by mistake passing the openstack release var down to the zuul
jobs, so all jobs are currently running under ocata.

This patch restores the missing line, thus fixing the opensuse jobs
and making sure the other jobs run under the correct release.

Change-Id: Ia7a488928e521de1afb821f141d77d2b0268ff0a

Change Id84e3b6e62e544582d6917047534e846e026798d added support for

commit_message:
Template custom HAProxy service configuration

Change Id84e3b6e62e544582d6917047534e846e026798d added support for
custom HAProxy service config using a plain copy of files in services.d.

Use a template action instead of a copy so that we can use variables and
iterate over group of hosts.

Change-Id: I1f07785932de4e4540422bd18af95241f05a67bf
(cherry picked from commit 49f334284b2b61f748c32eb434ddbb48bc9d6e59)

commit_message:
Install texttable and harmonize the way to install.

Fix the import during the documentation build. The module is required to
generate the file feature-configuration-generated. Add a documentation
requirement file and use the sphinx-build command to build the
documentation.

Change-Id: Ia64d4edc43efcc21f4de656a89c1748fb889ba70

commit_message:
Add Debian/source aarch64 CI job

AArch64 is getting popular and not all changes working on x86-64 work
properly on aarch64 architecture. Let check them.

Job is running in separate pipeline due to low number of aarch64 nodes.

Authored-By: Xinliang Liu <xinliang.liu@linaro.org>
Co-Authored-By: Jeffrey Zhang <zhang.lei.fly@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Marcin Juszkiewicz <marcin.juszkiewicz@linaro.org>

Implements: blueprint aarch64-3rd-party-ci-kolla

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/698606

Change-Id: I7e7802dfa4f4d9c61d01dba4b77c01cfb24301c0

commit_message:
Make SUSE job non-voting

Recent changes caused Apache to fail to start properly in
the SUSE job. This patch set temporarily makes them non-
voting to unblock other patches until a more permanent fix
is in place.

Change-Id: I7cbd45b8b761d921473869223bdafd0200723a64
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tlam@omegaprime.dev>

commit_message:

This picks up unreleased changes in sushy.
The cycle-with-intermediary deliverables are good to release frequently
whenever there are functional changes to be released. Feel free to -1
this patch if there are additional changes that should be included in
this release or if it is not a good time to do it.

Change-Id: I01944f968bab7b8c3e55135a93d32a3661fced50
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 14826, 'name': 'Mark Goddard', 'email': 'markgoddard86@gmail.com', 'username': 'mgoddard'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22629, 'name': 'Michal Nasiadka', 'email': 'mnasiadka@gmail.com', 'username': 'mnasiadka'}, {'_account_id': 24072, 'name': 'Marcin Juszkiewicz', 'email': 'mjuszkiewicz@redhat.com', 'username': 'hrw'}, {'_account_id': 30491, 'name': 'Radosław Piliszek', 'display_name': 'Radek', 'email': 'radek@piliszek.it', 'username': 'yoctozepto', 'status': 'self-employed techologist, collaborating mostly with 7bulls.com'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2019-12-16 10:36:14.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/mariadb/handlers/main.yml', 'zuul.d/base.yaml'], 'message': "Fix upgrades from older (<=10.1) MariaDB releases

Due to old row format pre-upgrade some current migrations
may fail to apply.
In Train this affects only Ubuntu.
This patch runs a script to change all row formats to DYNAMIC
which is the default in recent MariaDB releases.

This patch incorporates the following change to pass CI:

CI: Set zuul's ansible_python_interpreter to python2

Train, Stein & Rocky only

Zuul seems to have started setting ansible_python_interpreter to python3
on Ubuntu, which breaks our installation of kolla-ansible on Train and
earlier stable branches.

This change sets ansible_python_interpreter explicitly to python2. We
use host-vars rather than vars because zuul sets a host-var for
ansible_python_interpreter=auto, which overrides vars.

I9ba0d16972b31a64617461461fafaf2b436e2bdf by Mark Goddard

Change-Id: I3b39ec8d733b52a13cbc22b6f426b000584bab9d
Closes-bug: #1856296
"}]
commit_message:
Fix upgrades from older (<=10.1) MariaDB releases

Due to old row format pre-upgrade some current migrations
may fail to apply.
In Train this affects only Ubuntu.
This patch runs a script to change all row formats to DYNAMIC
which is the default in recent MariaDB releases.

This patch incorporates the following change to pass CI:

CI: Set zuul's ansible_python_interpreter to python2

Train, Stein & Rocky only

Zuul seems to have started setting ansible_python_interpreter to python3
on Ubuntu, which breaks our installation of kolla-ansible on Train and
earlier stable branches.

This change sets ansible_python_interpreter explicitly to python2. We
use host-vars rather than vars because zuul sets a host-var for
ansible_python_interpreter=auto, which overrides vars.

I9ba0d16972b31a64617461461fafaf2b436e2bdf by Mark Goddard

Change-Id: I3b39ec8d733b52a13cbc22b6f426b000584bab9d
Closes-bug: #1856296

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-12-11 13:21:06.000000000', 'files': ['files/debs/neutron-common'], 'message': "Include dnsmasq-utils package on all Ubuntu versions

This package provides dhcp_release tool but in files/debs/neutron-common
it was listed to be installed only on Ubuntu Precise.
The same file is also in Nova's packages but there is no restriction to
Ubuntu Precise only there.
So on all Neutron jobs it was fine but on Ironic's job where Nova
wasn't enabled, this package was not installed and caused problems
in Neutron DHCP agent.

Change-Id: Idd0711cfe6d43f21754a2f0c230cd094ea33cb27
Closes-Bug: #1855910
(cherry picked from commit f7a7076facbe8ef7c77863abf977af5cdafdeb6e)
"}]
commit_message:
Include dnsmasq-utils package on all Ubuntu versions

This package provides dhcp_release tool but in files/debs/neutron-common
it was listed to be installed only on Ubuntu Precise.
The same file is also in Nova's packages but there is no restriction to
Ubuntu Precise only there.
So on all Neutron jobs it was fine but on Ironic's job where Nova
wasn't enabled, this package was not installed and caused problems
in Neutron DHCP agent.

Change-Id: Idd0711cfe6d43f21754a2f0c230cd094ea33cb27
Closes-Bug: #1855910

commit_message:
Fix use of urlparse.urljoin

This method only joins the first two parameters, the 3rd parameter
is a bool "allow_fragments". Passing in "object_name" as the third
param resulted in it getting lost. Use os.path.join instead.

Change-Id: I49506b2671465bf43ae346225919d4a0e6767b20

subject: Remove the TripleO standalone job
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-11-21 09:29:35.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.yaml'], 'message': "Remove the TripleO standalone job

Despite the comment in .zuul.yaml this job actually doesn't use Mistral.
It is installed, but not used. This can be seen in the Mistral logs
which have minimal output (other than that of the workbooks being
loaded).

https://c867b5a19c86ae8c3ab7-a51f273e08e05c861a2fa6ace8476176.ssl.cf1.rackcdn.com/695212/2/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario003-standalone/4827980/logs/undercloud/var/log/containers/mistral/

Th other TripleO job also covers this case and then uses Mistral. This
patch removes the job which has been wasting resources for quite some
time now.

Change-Id: Ie3381c7226d50591192ae61697bdb0d134ddf4f1
"}]
commit_message:
Remove the TripleO standalone job

Despite the comment in .zuul.yaml this job actually doesn't use Mistral.
It is installed, but not used. This can be seen in the Mistral logs
which have minimal output (other than that of the workbooks being
loaded).

https://c867b5a19c86ae8c3ab7-a51f273e08e05c861a2fa6ace8476176.ssl.cf1.rackcdn.com/695212/2/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario003-standalone/4827980/logs/undercloud/var/log/containers/mistral/

Th other TripleO job also covers this case and then uses Mistral. This
patch removes the job which has been wasting resources for quite some
time now.

Change-Id: Ie3381c7226d50591192ae61697bdb0d134ddf4f1

commit_message:
Disable ExternalVipPort when deploying cell-compute

Compute cell stack does not require VIP ports in external
networks. Without this the stack creation fails since
most porbably the IP is already in use in multi cell
environment.

Change-Id: Ic3c8db1b3e96c3923d781de006780d236e361f48

commit_message:
Build images with healthcheck scripts for core services

blueprint container-health-check

Now docker supports healthcheck directive[0] in Dockerfile,
which is helpful for checking container aliveness.

Base for this patch were healthcheck scripts from tripleo[1].

[0] https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/builder/#healthcheck
[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-common/tree/master/healthcheck

Change-Id: Ifc32713cd4d6b45c74855c0ebf5bb65784701d44

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2019-12-13 11:44:25.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': 'Remove xtrace alteration in devstack/plugin.sh

Xtrace is enabled by default, but this pluging hook file disables it
making hard to debug plugin failures.

For understanding what is failing in devstack plugin xtraces are
required. Therefore this change is intended to leave xtrace options as
set by DevStack, that means enabled.

xtraces should be disabled only locally by stable functions that are
called too many times and filling log files of too verbose outputs.

Change-Id: I9d48fb4420c322badb9c811dccf826f7f2a66d2d
'}]
commit_message:
Remove xtrace alteration in devstack/plugin.sh

Xtrace is enabled by default, but this pluging hook file disables it
making hard to debug plugin failures.

For understanding what is failing in devstack plugin xtraces are
required. Therefore this change is intended to leave xtrace options as
set by DevStack, that means enabled.

xtraces should be disabled only locally by stable functions that are
called too many times and filling log files of too verbose outputs.

Change-Id: I9d48fb4420c322badb9c811dccf826f7f2a66d2d

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/695114/

Change-Id: I02c46773c1f640d3d37ddcf813ed9106fbdfc67a

commit_message:
Set ubuntu-bionic as default nodeset image

After support for Ubuntu Xenial has been drop, must switch
from ubuntu-xeanial to ubuntu-bionic default images for
default nodesets.

This is intended to fix jobs that are using DevStack
without caring about the version of the nodeset image
after below change broke them:

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/695114/

Change-Id: I02c46773c1f640d3d37ddcf813ed9106fbdfc67a

commit_message:
Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

pythn-vitrageclient is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/691178/

Change-Id: I6f4cc04134130a3fa36bb65492b01dff63f94e32

commit_message:
Exit running validations with a proper return code

This patch adds a proper return code management to validations running
CLI by raising an exception.

It also implement unittests for ThreadPoolExecutor.

Change-Id: Icd5075ba0526071d564c5424ced5b44a68484185
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

base: unify CentOS packages list

install type.

commit_message:
Refactor Apache httpd setup

All Apache httpd setup has been moved to a new helper script,
kolla_httpd_setup. This includes the existing clean of /run/httpd,
/var/run/httpd, /tmp/httpd etc.

Horizon has an additional bit of Apache config for Debian/binary, which
has been kept in extend_start.sh for horizon.

Change-Id: Ia2af74b69c151db0bd7e452460b0babcee50b282
Related: blueprint centos-rhel-8

commit_message:
Template custom HAProxy service configuration

Change Id84e3b6e62e544582d6917047534e846e026798d added support for
custom HAProxy service config using a plain copy of files in services.d.

Use a template action instead of a copy so that we can use variables and
iterate over group of hosts.

Change-Id: I1f07785932de4e4540422bd18af95241f05a67bf
(cherry picked from commit 49f334284b2b61f748c32eb434ddbb48bc9d6e59)

commit_message:
Bump tempest_concurrency from 3 to 2 to fix race issue

Lowering down the concurrency will help services apis to complete
requests by slowing down the call and it will fix the race
condition.

Related-Bug: #1855985

Change-Id: I80fe59da05a20bceb5ebfb359da30118bed6ae07
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Ensure PROCESS perm for sstuser on series-upgrade

This patch ensures that the PROCESS permission is added to the sstuser
user during a series upgrade from xenial to bionic.  Also patches the
README to correct some of the commands in terms of order of parameters.

Change-Id: I8ddc21e3914e3da0f64ffcedef7a6a4bb18ba4cb
Closes-Bug: #1838044

commit_message:
[neutron] Adjust neighbour table thresholds

When clouds have a large number of hosts, the default size of the ARP
cache is too small. The cache can overflow, which means that the system
has no way to reach some IP addresses.

Increasing threshold limits addresses the situation, in a reasonably
safe way (the maximum impact is 5MB or so of additional RAM used).

More context on this issue:

* http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man7/arp.7.html
* https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-nova-compute/+bug/1780348
* https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1488938
* https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1690087
* https://github.com/crowbar/crowbar-openstack/commit/0583a0c94996df6b784229e8a534f955eaca85bc
* https://github.com/crowbar/crowbar-openstack/commit/3dd21ea62ac152e40bfdfee4b8e25a528c82a79f
* https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/1651a1805a16212299fe0a91aebb2a91ed39bc6e

Change-Id: I60c871e8eb9f2c086818ff077987f2390930800c
Closes-Bug: #1844349

commit_message:
Stop using six library

Since we've dropped support for Python 2.7, it's time to look at
the bright future that Python 3.x will bring and stop forcing
compatibility with older versions.
This patch removes the six library from requirements, not
looking back.

Change-Id: I8e2b271d0e1c4ef61b73d2e5072dc47c3276cda2

commit_message:
Support configuration of Docker client timeout

Adds support for configuration of the Docker client timeout via
'docker_client_timeout'.

This change also increases the default timeout to 120 seconds, as we
sometimes see timeouts in CI and heavily loaded or underpowered
environments. Increasing 'docker_client_timeout' further may be helpful
in cases where Docker reports 'Read timed out'.

Change-Id: I73745771078cb2c0ebae2b1d87ba2c4c12958d82
Closes-Bug: #1809844
(cherry picked from commit 01050dc01fa8558eb453c48faa2a8efd398c5367)

commit_message:
Support configuration of Docker client timeout

Adds support for configuration of the Docker client timeout via
'docker_client_timeout'.

This change also increases the default timeout to 120 seconds, as we
sometimes see timeouts in CI and heavily loaded or underpowered
environments. Increasing 'docker_client_timeout' further may be helpful
in cases where Docker reports 'Read timed out'.

Change-Id: I73745771078cb2c0ebae2b1d87ba2c4c12958d82
Closes-Bug: #1809844
(cherry picked from commit 01050dc01fa8558eb453c48faa2a8efd398c5367)

commit_message:
Flesh out RevertResizeTask.rollback

This implements the TODO in the RevertResizeTask.rollback
method by logging an exception with some details and also
setting the instance to ERROR state, recording a fault
and sending an error notification, similar to the rollback
method in ConfirmResizeTask.

As noted inline, the exception message could be more detailed
but I've left that for a later change in case people want more
details.

Part of blueprint cross-cell-resize

Change-Id: I41296696da3226767d2bacba9345d829529ce4b6

commit_message:
Release Octavia stable branches.

This patch proposes bugfix releases for the following stable branches:

Rocky 3.2.1
Stein 4.1.1
Train 5.0.1

Primary fixes are:
1. Better handling of issues with certificates and TLS offload.
2. Improved controller shutdown.
3. Fixed API filtering with tags and the provider capabilities list.

Change-Id: I437d2246c4dc9f8d7903227497c5bf252004dcdb

commit_message:
set selinux to permissive for image build

In RHEL8 nodepool image, selinux is set to enforcing which
cause failures as in rdocloud we run the jobs using permissive
selinux mode, enabling this flag will help to toggle the
status of selinux.

Change-Id: Ief177d2a41afdaf013efb5ab5e51c0d452487467
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 14826, 'name': 'Mark Goddard', 'email': 'markgoddard86@gmail.com', 'username': 'mgoddard'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22629, 'name': 'Michal Nasiadka', 'email': 'mnasiadka@gmail.com', 'username': 'mnasiadka'}, {'_account_id': 30491, 'name': 'Radosław Piliszek', 'display_name': 'Radek', 'email': 'radek@piliszek.it', 'username': 'yoctozepto', 'status': 'self-employed techologist, collaborating mostly with 7bulls.com'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-12-13 16:08:22.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/base.yaml'], 'message': "CI: Set zuul's ansible_python_interpreter to python2

Train, Stein & Rocky only

Zuul seems to have started setting ansible_python_interpreter to python3
on Ubuntu, which breaks our installation of kolla-ansible on Train and
earlier stable branches.

This change sets ansible_python_interpreter explicitly to python2. We
use host-vars rather than vars because zuul sets a host-var for
ansible_python_interpreter=auto, which overrides vars.

"}]
commit_message:
CI: Set zuul's ansible_python_interpreter to python2

Train, Stein & Rocky only

Zuul seems to have started setting ansible_python_interpreter to python3
on Ubuntu, which breaks our installation of kolla-ansible on Train and
earlier stable branches.

This change sets ansible_python_interpreter explicitly to python2. We
use host-vars rather than vars because zuul sets a host-var for
ansible_python_interpreter=auto, which overrides vars.

Change-Id: I9ba0d16972b31a64617461461fafaf2b436e2bdf

commit_message:
CI: Set zuul's ansible_python_interpreter to python2

Train, Stein & Rocky only

Zuul seems to have started setting ansible_python_interpreter to python3
on Ubuntu, which breaks our installation of kolla-ansible on Train and
earlier stable branches.

This change sets ansible_python_interpreter explicitly to python2. We
use host-vars rather than vars because zuul sets a host-var for
ansible_python_interpreter=auto, which overrides vars.

Change-Id: I9ba0d16972b31a64617461461fafaf2b436e2bdf

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Designate is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/693631/
Change-Id: I5a5bdc859f87f82097b95b2ebb31edb6e9b72b3a

subject: BugFix: modify the max allocation limit of acceleration resources
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2019-12-15 08:58:30.000000000', 'files': ['cyborg/conductor/manager.py'], 'message': 'BugFix: modify the max allocation limit of acceleration resources

The max unit of acceleration resources should be set to maximum
instead of min(1).

like nova:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/9316976946c04573bbd18128bbb0674937c4eaf1/nova/virt/hyperv/hostops.py#L265

For the reason, pls see the Story.

commit_message:
Remove native ssl support

As eventlet ssl termination is broken with python 3 and
we won't be supporting python 2.7 anymore we will just
remove ssl termination to glance-api and expect the
termination being handled by something else, like HAProxy.

This patch also removes the broken ssl test job as the
non-existing feature is not broken anymore.

Change-Id: Iaf16dfcfdb3a2c93312dcad1ea1229e6b3c8caaa

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ia9cca011e563363381167a6c4afd402d52f8e828

subject: Add procname for uwsgi based service cyborg-api
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-12-02 11:10:54.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/lib/cyborg'], 'message': 'Add procname for uwsgi based service cyborg-api

Code in grenade and elsewhere rely on the process/service name
when one runs "ps auxw" and they grep for example "grep -e cyborg-api"
to check if the service is running. with uwsgi, let us make sure
we use process name prefix so it is easier to spot the services
and be compatible with code elsewhere that relies on this.

Reference:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/494531/

Change-Id: I7afa389160d3a2355e7a077fec2570423254c83d
'}]
commit_message:
Add procname for uwsgi based service cyborg-api

Code in grenade and elsewhere rely on the process/service name
when one runs "ps auxw" and they grep for example "grep -e cyborg-api"
to check if the service is running. with uwsgi, let us make sure
we use process name prefix so it is easier to spot the services
and be compatible with code elsewhere that relies on this.

Reference:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/494531/

Change-Id: I7afa389160d3a2355e7a077fec2570423254c83d

subject: Fix nginx getting OOM killed
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-12-13 22:42:02.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/fix-nginx-getting-oom-killed-76139fd8b57e6c15.yaml', 'magnum/drivers/common/templates/kubernetes/helm/ingress-nginx.sh'], 'message': 'Fix nginx getting OOM killed

* Set requests.memory=256MiB  for the nginx-ingress-controller pod
We decided to leave limits open as this will allow to support most
of the generic use cases.
* QoS from Guaranteed to Burstable
This will make that application and ingress starve each other,
both fighting for node resources for an optimal usage of CPU
* Set priority class so that pods can take priority on a node that
might have No CPU taint.

task: 37625
story: 2006945

Change-Id: Ibc77ea64ad47f1a400d040f419f38bf52b9f0141
Signed-off-by: Diogo Guerra <diogo.filipe.tomas.guerra@cern.ch>
(cherry picked from commit e75e28dcbf2c6281e175fbe05217712e8e879a01)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix nginx getting OOM killed

* Set requests.memory=256MiB  for the nginx-ingress-controller pod
We decided to leave limits open as this will allow to support most
of the generic use cases.
* QoS from Guaranteed to Burstable
This will make that application and ingress starve each other,
both fighting for node resources for an optimal usage of CPU
* Set priority class so that pods can take priority on a node that
might have No CPU taint.

task: 37625
story: 2006945

Change-Id: Ibc77ea64ad47f1a400d040f419f38bf52b9f0141
Signed-off-by: Diogo Guerra <diogo.filipe.tomas.guerra@cern.ch>
(cherry picked from commit e75e28dcbf2c6281e175fbe05217712e8e879a01)

Install policycoreutils-python in RHEL/CentOS 7.
Install policycoreutils-python-utils in Fedora and RHEL/CentOS 8.

This patch also drops python3-setuptools from bindep as Fedora 28 is

commit_message:
Update bindep for RHEL/CentOS 8

Install policycoreutils-python in RHEL/CentOS 7.
Install policycoreutils-python-utils in Fedora and RHEL/CentOS 8.

This patch also drops python3-setuptools from bindep as Fedora 28 is
EOL and RPM dependency is fixed in >= Fedora 29.

Change-Id: I0ecd29e0f113005d7e993add84d2c4fb90fd16e3

commit_message:
Mask the token used to allow access to consoles

Hide the novncproxy token from the logs.

When backported this patch needs to be extended to handle the same issue
in the consoleauth service.

Co-Authored-By:paul-carlton2 <paul.carlton2@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By:Tristan Cacqueray <tdecacqu@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I5b8fa4233d297722c3af08176901d12887bae3de
Closes-Bug: #1492140
(cherry picked from commit 26d4047e17eba9bc271f8868f1d0ffeec97b555e)

commit_message:
Create a controller for qga when SEV is used

When a guest agent is requested, it requires a virtio-serial controller.
If the controller is not created explicitly, it will be created by
libvirt. But if AMD SEV is also requested, the controller is expected
to use the iommu driver.

In order to achive that, the controller is created explicitly with the
required driver.

Change-Id: I47c248649b9d77e8bd7c5350fc84d89342be4623
Closes-Bug: 1845986
(cherry picked from commit c2fd8294fdb615d5229c4eb2abef1226b7cc580b)

Ie54fca066f33 added logic to libvirt/designer.py for enabling iommu
for certain devices where virtio is used.  This is required for AMD

Firstly, a SCSI controller can have the model as 'virtio-scsi', e.g.:

commit_message:
Also enable iommu for virtio controllers and video in libvirt

Ie54fca066f33 added logic to libvirt/designer.py for enabling iommu
for certain devices where virtio is used.  This is required for AMD
SEV[0].  However it missed two cases.

Firstly, a SCSI controller can have the model as 'virtio-scsi', e.g.:

    <controller type='scsi' index='0' model='virtio-scsi'>

As with other virtio devices, here a child element needs to be added
to the config when SEV is enabled:

    <driver iommu="on" />

We do not need to cover the case of a controller with type
'virtio-serial' now, since even though it is supported by libvirt, it
is not currently used anywhere in Nova.

Secondly, a video device can be virtio, e.g. when vgpus are in use:

    <video>
        <model type='virtio'/>
    </video>

Also take this opportunity to clarify the corresponding documentation
around disk bus options.

[0] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/train/approved/amd-sev-libvirt-support.html#proposed-change

Partial-Bug: #1845986
Change-Id: I626c35d1653e6a25125320032d0a4a0c67ab8bcf
(cherry picked from commit 1a88d35cb161df34f11ce17fed3b62621f774672)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-12-12 15:21:46.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/config.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_config.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/designer.py'], 'message': "Switch to uses_virtio to enable iommu driver for AMD SEV

In order to use AMD SEV, devices that use virtio should also use
iommu driver. The problem is to understand that a device uses virtio,
because there are many attributes and values that can indicate it.
For example, it can be `model='virtio'` for rng and
`<target bus='virtio'/>` for disk.

Add new property for devices `uses_virtio`, that will indicate that a
device in its current configuration is a virtio device, and implement it
for known devices.

The patch does not change how resulting libvirt XMLs look and does not
fix user-visible bugs. This refactoring is required for further work on
AMD SEV related patches.

The changes to memballoon-related tests were required because the tests
were using fake values that does are not possible in real life and that
were preventing tests of the new method. The tests now use the value
that nova currently uses to generate libvirt xml.

Change-Id: I0f85918996128d573b5dbd6ac49a9c2356cd40a9
Partial-Bug: #1845986
(cherry picked from commit 2b0024c04070dcffc056e9df7b9ced40cbfdcc00)
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to uses_virtio to enable iommu driver for AMD SEV

In order to use AMD SEV, devices that use virtio should also use
iommu driver. The problem is to understand that a device uses virtio,
because there are many attributes and values that can indicate it.
For example, it can be `model='virtio'` for rng and
`<target bus='virtio'/>` for disk.

Add new property for devices `uses_virtio`, that will indicate that a
device in its current configuration is a virtio device, and implement it
for known devices.

The patch does not change how resulting libvirt XMLs look and does not
fix user-visible bugs. This refactoring is required for further work on
AMD SEV related patches.

The changes to memballoon-related tests were required because the tests
were using fake values that does are not possible in real life and that
were preventing tests of the new method. The tests now use the value
that nova currently uses to generate libvirt xml.

Change-Id: I0f85918996128d573b5dbd6ac49a9c2356cd40a9
Partial-Bug: #1845986
(cherry picked from commit 2b0024c04070dcffc056e9df7b9ced40cbfdcc00)

commit_message:
Fix service_uuid migration for volumes with no host

For volumes that have no host assigned, this
migration will fail.  Skip those volumes, as they
don't need to be updated.

Closes-Bug: #1821207
Change-Id: I08487575e52c5cfd5a268a23d97b6bd931aeaa45
(cherry picked from commit 47d2a98fa63fb1bdf122c8a40bd06ea9c1709855)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-10-13 02:54:15.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/static/js/angular/directives/serialConsole.js'], 'message': 'Send binary frame in websocket client

Websockify 0.9.0 rejected receiving text frame:
https://github.com/novnc/websockify/commit/8eb5cb0cdcd1314d6d763df8f226b587a2396aa2
We have to switch to binary frame instead.

commit_message:
Send binary frame in websocket client

Websockify 0.9.0 rejected receiving text frame:
https://github.com/novnc/websockify/commit/8eb5cb0cdcd1314d6d763df8f226b587a2396aa2
We have to switch to binary frame instead.

Change-Id: I2677b8879ccb27def22126811c347d5c08f5aada
Closes-Bug: #1847889

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2019-12-13 17:39:06.000000000', 'files': ['os_brick/tests/initiator/connectors/test_iscsi.py', 'os_brick/initiator/connectors/iscsi.py'], 'message': 'iscsi: Add _get_device_link retry when waiting for /dev/disk/by-id/ to populate

Bug #1820007 documents failures to find /dev/disk/by-id/ symlinks
associated with encrypted volumes both in real world and CI
environments. These failures appear to be due to udev on these slow or
overloaded hosts failing to populate the required /dev/disk/by-id/
symlinks in time after the iSCSI volume has been connected.

This change seeks to avoid such failures by simply decorating
_get_device_link with the @utils.retry to hopefully allow udev time to
create the required symlinks under /dev/disk/by-id/.

Closes-Bug: #1820007
Change-Id: Ib9c8ebae7a6051e18538920139fecd123682a474
(cherry picked from commit 331316827a60aa50ee26be08a06027525f5194ef)
(cherry picked from commit d8ed21e7d25f67c6d2bfe71515723f68ce15b887)
(cherry picked from commit d1f84dfd897d35053d39c22ae484f6586d1268bd)
'}]
commit_message:
iscsi: Add _get_device_link retry when waiting for /dev/disk/by-id/ to populate

Bug #1820007 documents failures to find /dev/disk/by-id/ symlinks
associated with encrypted volumes both in real world and CI
environments. These failures appear to be due to udev on these slow or
overloaded hosts failing to populate the required /dev/disk/by-id/
symlinks in time after the iSCSI volume has been connected.

This change seeks to avoid such failures by simply decorating
_get_device_link with the @utils.retry to hopefully allow udev time to
create the required symlinks under /dev/disk/by-id/.

Closes-Bug: #1820007
Change-Id: Ib9c8ebae7a6051e18538920139fecd123682a474
(cherry picked from commit 331316827a60aa50ee26be08a06027525f5194ef)
(cherry picked from commit d8ed21e7d25f67c6d2bfe71515723f68ce15b887)
(cherry picked from commit d1f84dfd897d35053d39c22ae484f6586d1268bd)

commit_message:
Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

python-zunclient is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/691178/

Change-Id: I5f5eead1282cea042152d3f78b19667ffe6c6929

commit_message:
Support HEALTHY status for db instance

- 'HEALTHY' means the db service is responsive, 'ACTIVE' means the db
  service is alive.
- Remove the CI job fakemodetests, but will add similar testing task in
  the future.
- Fix the periodic CI job
- Remove MongoDB and  related jobs

Change-Id: I5abe9091ba203297dc87db5fba139179166321f7

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2019-11-13 19:02:50.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'cinder/volume/drivers/dell_emc/powermax/metadata.py', 'cinder/cmd/manage.py', 'lower-constraints.txt', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_cmd.py'], 'message': "Convert PrettyTable usage to tabulate

PrettyTable is no longer maintained and the last release was in 2013.
There are starting to be deprecation warnings emitted with newer Python
releases.

Various attempts to revive a fork haven't gained much traction. A common
recommendation is to move away from PrettyTable to tabulate. This
switches our usage to a close equivalent using that library instead.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/694093

Change-Id: I9c164f02a78fd6b228e1e3adc3a09a182fb82de9
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Convert PrettyTable usage to tabulate

PrettyTable is no longer maintained and the last release was in 2013.
There are starting to be deprecation warnings emitted with newer Python
releases.

Various attempts to revive a fork haven't gained much traction. A common
recommendation is to move away from PrettyTable to tabulate. This
switches our usage to a close equivalent using that library instead.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/694093

Change-Id: I9c164f02a78fd6b228e1e3adc3a09a182fb82de9
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
octavia: use octavia::nova for enable_anti_affinity param

I9e636b2d420497f7bf65912fddf7cba72d350a9e is problematic if operators
use octavia::nova and octavia::controller together; so we will revert
the patch in puppet-octavia and update the hieradata here so there is no
resource duplication.

Change-Id: Icc22990e5bf7838532a0902dfb21b9aacaa92c8b

commit_message:
virt: Provide block_device_info during a rescue

Allowing individual virt drivers to then use all block devices
associated with an instance during a rescue in the future.

Implements: blueprint virt-rescue-stable-disk-devices
Change-Id: Ia23b6baebfb2c5a2694dfacd61e68d558daa6a08

subject: Support trying all available tokens
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2019-12-11 14:36:43.000000000', 'files': ['src/reactive/barbican_vault_handlers.py', 'unit_tests/test_barbican_vault_handlers.py'], 'message': 'Support trying all available tokens

Since the relation with vault maybe contain more than one
token and we have no way to know if they are valid, we
support trying them all until we get a good one and raise
the error only if we tried them all unsuccessfully and
have no current secret-id otherwise return current
secret-id.

Change-Id: I2ee5ffe5d53e874efb3fabc6a880bf95b00a44f9
Partial-Bug: #1849323
'}]
commit_message:
Support trying all available tokens

Since the relation with vault maybe contain more than one
token and we have no way to know if they are valid, we
support trying them all until we get a good one and raise
the error only if we tried them all unsuccessfully and
have no current secret-id otherwise return current
secret-id.

Change-Id: I2ee5ffe5d53e874efb3fabc6a880bf95b00a44f9
Partial-Bug: #1849323
